towns.name: Nazareth
towns.theme: Hometown that doesn't believe in you
towns.biblical_reference: Luke 4:24 (No prophet is accepted in his hometown)

story.default: Nazareth is DEEPLY skeptical of Jesus. Townspeople remember him as 'just the carpenter's son.' You know, the kid who used to build chairs? Yeah, THAT guy. Tutorial involves proving yourself by helping with small tasks. No pressure!
story.christian_edition: Nazareth is skeptical of Jesus. The townspeople remember him as the carpenter's son and struggle to see him as anything more. You must prove yourself through humble service.

towns.name: Cana
towns.theme: Wedding celebration, water to wine miracle

problem.default: Wedding has run out of wine. Celebration is FALLING APART. Guests are getting cranky. The bride is panicking. This is a DISASTER. Social catastrophe imminent!
problem.christian_edition: The wedding has run out of wine. The celebration is at risk, and the family faces embarrassment. A miracle is needed to save the day.

towns.unique_mechanic: Wine Jars Puzzle - Arrange stone jars in correct pattern
towns.exit_requirement: Use Bartholomew's Illusion Detection to reveal hidden path

towns.name: Capernaum
towns.theme: Miraculous catch of fish, fishing industry

boss.name: The Paralytic's Four Friends
boss.description: Not a traditional fight - timed puzzle boss

problem.default: SEVERE fish shortage. Economy collapsing. Everyone's broke and hungry. Peter won't leave until the community is helped because he's stubborn and loyal like that. Classic Peter.
problem.christian_edition: A severe fish shortage threatens the town's economy. Peter, faithful to his community, refuses to leave until he can help provide for those in need.

towns.unique_mechanic: Net Fishing Mini-Game - Catch rare fish
towns.exit_requirement: Use Peter's Stone Moving to push boulder aside

towns.name: Bethsaida
towns.theme: Blind leading the blind, healing of blind man

problem.default: Mysterious affliction causing blindness. Town struggling to function. Literally the BLIND leading the BLIND. It's chaos. People keep walking into things. Not great!
problem.christian_edition: A mysterious affliction is causing blindness throughout the town. The people struggle to function in darkness, both physical and spiritual.

towns.unique_mechanic: Navigate in Darkness - Use sound cues and echolocation
towns.exit_requirement: Andrew's Social Recruitment to gather crowd to lower bridge

towns.name: Magdala
towns.biblical_reference: Luke 8:2 (seven demons cast out of Mary Magdalene)

problem.default: Merchants are POSSESSED and acting irrationally greedy. Like, MORE greedy than normal merchants. Prices are INSANE. Chaos in the marketplace. Economic nightmare!
problem.christian_edition: The merchants have been possessed by demons, causing them to act with extreme greed. The marketplace has descended into chaos and needs deliverance.

towns.unique_mechanic: Exorcism Rhythm Game - Time button presses to beat
towns.exit_requirement: James uses Weather Control to calm storm

towns.name: Chorazin
towns.biblical_reference: Matthew 11:21 (Jesus curses Chorazin for not repenting)
towns.description: Ruins town, haunted by unrepentant past

problem.default: Town in RUINS after being cursed for not repenting. Few residents remain. Haunted by its unrepentant past. Very awkward. Everyone's living with that 'we were warned' mentality.
problem.christian_edition: The town lies in ruins after being cursed for its refusal to repent. Few residents remain, and all are haunted by their past choices.

towns.exit_requirement: John reads Ancient Text on sealed door

towns.name: Tiberias
towns.theme: Roman occupation, Herod Antipas, power dynamics
towns.biblical_reference: Luke 23:7-12 (Herod wants to see Jesus), Mark 6:14-29 (Herod killed John Baptist)

gladiator_arena.description: Battle challenge mode with rare items

problem.default: HEAVY taxation. Roman oppression. Herod wants Jesus to perform miracles for ENTERTAINMENT. Like a circus act. The audacity! 'Do a miracle for me!' Nope. Not happening.
problem.christian_edition: The people suffer under heavy taxation and Roman oppression. Herod Antipas seeks Jesus, hoping to see him perform miraculous signs for entertainment.

towns.unique_mechanic: Render Unto Caesar Puzzle - Calculate exact tax amounts
towns.exit_requirement: Philip solves complex gate mechanism (math puzzle)

towns.name: Gadara
towns.theme: Legion and Gerasene Demoniac, Gentile lands

problem.default: Demoniac TERRORIZES the region. Pig farmers losing livestock. Man's possessed by LEGION (yes, multiple demons, they couldn't share?). Absolute chaos. Send help!
problem.christian_edition: A demon-possessed man terrorizes the region. Local pig farmers are losing their livestock. The man is possessed by many demons and needs deliverance.

towns.unique_mechanic: Herd the Pigs - Don't let possessed pigs reach cliff

towns.name: Samaria
towns.theme: Woman at the Well, Jewish-Samaritan tensions
towns.description: Cultural tension zone, prejudice and division

problem.default: Deep cultural division between Jews and Samaritans. Town LITERALLY split by a wall. Not metaphorical. Actual wall. Peak pettiness. Nobody talks to each other. Wonderful atmosphere.
problem.christian_edition: Deep cultural division separates Jews and Samaritans in this town. A wall literally divides the community, representing centuries of hatred and prejudice.

towns.unique_mechanic: Diplomacy System - Dialogue choices affect outcomes

towns.name: Jericho
towns.theme: Walls of Jericho, Rahab's story, humility

problem.default: Corrupt officials REBUILT the walls to trap people inside. City divided. Walls of Jericho 2.0: This Time They're Corrupt Edition. Someone call a trumpet player!
problem.christian_edition: Corrupt officials have rebuilt the walls of Jericho to trap and control the people. The city is divided, and liberation is needed.

towns.unique_mechanic: Sound Puzzle - Play trumpet notes to weaken walls

towns.name: Bethany
towns.theme: Raising of Lazarus, death and resurrection

problem.default: Lazarus has DIED. Town is grieving. Graveyard is haunted (because of course it is). Everyone's devastated. Mary and Martha are heartbroken. Four days in the tomb. It's BAD.
problem.christian_edition: Lazarus has died, and the town mourns deeply. Mary and Martha grieve for their brother. The graveyard is haunted by death's presence. Hope seems lost.

towns.unique_mechanic: See to Believe - Hidden enemies only appear when proven
towns.exit_requirement: Thomas's Trap Detection to navigate treacherous path

towns.name: Bethlehem
towns.theme: Massacre of Innocents, trauma and healing

boss.name: The Captain of Herod's Guard (Ghost of Guilt)

problem.default: Town TRAUMATIZED by Herod's past massacre. Captain's ghost haunts the area, consumed by guilt. Heavy topic. Dark stuff. Everyone needs healing. Handle with care.
problem.christian_edition: The town bears deep trauma from the massacre of innocents ordered by Herod. The captain's ghost, tormented by guilt, haunts the area. The community needs healing.

towns.tone_warning: Darkest subject - handled with care, abstract representation
towns.exit_requirement: Thaddaeus's Secret Passages to find hidden road
towns.special_choice: Can FIGHT or FORGIVE the boss

towns.name: Jerusalem

problem.default: Passover approaching. Last Supper preparations underway. Judas is... troubled. Something's OFF with him. Tension in the air. End-game incoming. This is it.
problem.christian_edition: Passover is approaching, and preparations for the Last Supper are underway. Judas is troubled in spirit. The final chapter of Jesus's earthly ministry begins.

towns.ending: Last Supper begins, Jesus says 'One of you will betray me,' credits roll
